intro: Hoffmannia villosula, commonly known as the woolly hoffmannia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its dense, woolly foliage that covers its stems and leaves. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Hoffmannia villosula is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
